intro: Xolisma mariana, commonly known as the mountain dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high elevations, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are generally lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive purple center. Xolisma mariana is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
